```markdown
# abort-controller

An implementation of the WHATWG AbortController interface.  This package provides a polyfill for environments lacking native `AbortController` support, particularly older browsers like IE11.

[![npm version](https://img.shields.io/npm/v/abort-controller.svg)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/abort-controller)
[![Downloads/month](https://img.shields.io/npm/dm/abort-controller.svg)](http://www.npmtrends.com/abort-controller)
[![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/mysticatea/abort-controller.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/mysticatea/abort-controller)
[![Coverage Status](https://codecov.io/gh/mysticatea/abort-controller/branch/master/graph/badge.svg)](https://codecov.io/gh/mysticatea/abort-controller)
[![Dependency Status](https://david-dm.org/mysticatea/abort-controller.svg)](https://david-dm.org/mysticatea/abort-controller)

## Installation

Use npm:

```bash
npm install abort-controller
```

Alternatively, you can download the bundled files directly from the `dist` directory:

- `dist/abort-controller.mjs` (ESM)
- `dist/abort-controller.js` (CommonJS)
- `dist/abort-controller.umd.js` (UMD)  This UMD version is Babel-transpiled for compatibility with older browsers like IE 11.


## Usage

### Basic Example

```javascript
import AbortController from "abort-controller";

const controller = new AbortController();
const signal = controller.signal;

signal.addEventListener("abort", () => {
  console.log("Request aborted!");
});

// ... perform your operation using the signal ...

controller.abort(); // Trigger the abort
```


### Polyfilling (for environments without native AbortController)

To polyfill `AbortController` for environments lacking native support, import the polyfill:

```javascript
import "abort-controller/polyfill"; // Important for older browsers like IE11
```

This is often necessary when targeting older browsers or frameworks.

### Using the UMD version (for older browsers)

If you need to support browsers like IE11, you must use the UMD version (the `abort-controller.umd.js` file) directly, usually by adding it as a script tag in your HTML:

```html
<script src="./dist/abort-controller.umd.js"></script>
```

Then, you can access `AbortController` as a global variable:

```javascript
const controller = new AbortController();
```

### API Reference

#### `AbortController`

The core class that manages the abort signal.

##### `controller.signal`

An `AbortSignal` object associated with the controller.  Event listeners added to this signal will be notified of the abort.

##### `controller.abort()`

Triggers the abort process, sending the "abort" event to any listeners attached to `signal`.


## Troubleshooting

- **Missing `AbortController`:** If you're getting errors about `AbortController` being undefined, ensure you've installed the package and are using the appropriate import/require method based on your project setup.  Consider using `abort-controller/polyfill` for older browsers.
- **Incorrect import:** Double-check the import path or require statement to make sure it matches the installed package location.
- **UMD use:** If you're using the UMD version, ensure you've included the script tag in your HTML file.


## Contributing

Contributions are welcome!  Please see the [GitHub repository](https://github.com/mysticatea/abort-controller) for more details.
